reviews.sentence: Great value and convenience. The hotel is located a little south of the center of La Jola in a non congested area within walking distance to the Windandsea Beach – a great place for enjoying the sunset. It ’s a short drive to downtown LaJola but we found parking near the Museum of Contemporary Art and avoided the congestion of the town. The woman at the desk was super friendly and recommended a great sandwich shop next door. The hotel is n’t new but it ’s clean comfortable and convenient. It would definitely be my pick next time. The price was was much better than others I had checked out especially considering that parking was free.

Great value and convenience. The hotel is located a little south of the center of La Jola in a non congested area within walking distance to the Windandsea Beach – a great place for enjoying the sunset. It ’s a short drive to downtown LaJola but we found parking near the Museum of Contemporary Art and avoided the congestion of the town. The woman at the desk was super friendly and recommended a great sandwich shop next door. The hotel is n’t new but it ’s clean comfortable and convenient. It would definitely be my pick next time. The price was was much better than others I had checked out especially considering that parking was free.

I ’d go back anytime. Just wonderful value – the staff were really helpful the rooms unexciting but clean functional and have everything you may need. WiFi was free the local area has some good eateries for all tastes and it ’s a short walk to the shore and beaches. OK it ’s not downtown La Jola but the fortune you save on the room can be invested in the odd taxi fare or parking charge. The slightly dated motel style with rooms all opening on to the big wide world was for me a plus point and gave added character the downside is that inconsiderate guests making late arrival or early departure noise can be disturbing. So to sum up for a good practical affordable hotel it gets my vote.

Excellent Value. Outstanding Location. We plan to stay here again in the future. The king room was approximately 15x18 with refrigerator and microwave plus table. The only real problems with the property are the tiny bathrooms and cramped parking lot. Free continental breakfast was okay but next door is the best breakfast and coffee restaurant in town at bargain prices Cafe Vihak. Su Casa Mexican Restaurant is just across the street. And you are less than 2 blocks from the beach and surfing waves. Within 5 minutes you are on Prospect a Lane in La Jola and 15 minutes you can be at Sea World Point Loma or downtown San Diego. Stay here and have more money to enjoy the great seafood.

Very clean motel which is located near most everything you. Very clean motel which is located near most everything you would want to see in the La Jola La Jola shores area. It has adequate parking an on site pool and a 1 short block walk to the beach. I would stay here again when in town.

Wonderful. We were looking for something we could afford and this fit the bill very nicely. We were thrilled with the friendly service breakfast comfort space and room overall. The location was terrific. I walked about 2 blocks to the beautiful Windansea beach every day to La Jola etc. Best value I have ever experienced. I highly recommend. Parking lot is not large but we always found a snug spot. it is not flashy but you can not beat the value.

Friendly staff short walk to the beach. We went here to escape the heat of the desert for the 4th of July. The room was quiet and had nice amenities. All staff members were very friendly and helpful. Heated pool hot tub and laundry on site were definite pluses. True to the area the parking lot was tiny and exiting the parking lot was very tough because it was a one way street so you had to turn right and go all the way down to the beach so you could turn left and leave the area. There were plenty of shops and restaurants within walking distance which was great. The area is also very conducive to running. I would return to this hotel again.
Travel Lodge La Jola. This hotel was older but very clean. There were places close by to eat. Parking was difficult but was at the hotel.

Excellent value for a clean room. Stayed for 2 nights in March 2015. The room was clean and surprisingly quiet given the proximity to the road. We were on the second floor and face the road parking lot but did not appreciate an inordinate amount of noise. We had the king room which was a nice sized room. The bathroom is cozy but more than fits the bill. In room fridge microwave were helpful. The staff was very helpful and professional. The continental breakfast was adequate coffee pastries to get the day started. It is a 5 minute walk to the beach and a 5 10 minute drive to everything in La Jola. Folks remember this is a Travelodge. If you want a spa pool personal masseuse etc go to a hotel where the cost of valet parking overnight will be what you spend on a room at this Travelodge. If you are looking for a clean comfortable quiet room in a safe area I do not think there is an unsafe area in LaJola. that will not break the bank I suggest you consider this one.

Folks remember this is a Travelodge. If you want a spa pool personal masseuse etc go to a hotel where the cost of valet parking overnight will be what you spend on a room at this Travelodge. If you are looking for a clean comfortable quiet room in a safe area I do not think there is an unsafe area in LaJola. that will not break the bank I suggest you consider this one.

Booked. 1 night stayed 5. We booked in for 1 night thinking that we might move in closer to downtown San Diego the next day. We found that the drive wAs easy and decided to stay. The staff were really great. This small older property is clean and appears to be very well managed. There is not a lot of parking but we did get a spot each night on a holiday weekend. The breakfast area is crowded with no place to sit inside. We chose to sit on the park benches outside and enjoyed it. We noticed some people got trays and took their food back to their rooms. The weather was great so why not sit outside. Tricia and Olga were our contacts and they were both very pleasant. Would go back there for sure.

Travelodge was great location for the money. The staff was extremely friendly and knowledgeable very accommodating and the location was great. Would recommend using a smart phone to get directions to Mission Bay and Gas Lamp district. Take LaJola Blvd. all the way to Mission Bay is really fast. There is an excellent Italian Restaurant right on LaJola Blvd. about 4 miles from the Travelodge. Recommend it highly. Voce Del Mare 5721 La Jola Blvd. The hotel is more like a motel. Very dated but for the money I was not expecting a 5 star. Although it is walking distance to the beach the actual beach is not conducive for just sunbathing. It is very rocky. Recommend going to Mission Beach just a few miles down. There is also free public parking.

Budget Stay. A nice location for a short stay. Free parking and free continental breakfast. Very dated accommodation breakfast is a bit of a pain to collect from reception and to sit around the pool or take back to the room.
Good size rooms hard to park if you drive a truck but really nice place.

Great price and no problems with parking. Close to la Jola village but far from freeway. The room we had was newly renovated with new bathroom and flooring. Construction next door starting around 8 am. Odd tapping noise from above when there is nothing above us. A closet would be great so we can hang clothes andor wet towels as there were no hooks in the bathroom.
Nice clean place to stay. The staff was kind to give an id item we lost in the parking lot to the front desk and the front desk called to let us know they had it.

It is a short walk to the beach. That was nice. The hotel is under construction and there were big boxes all over the parking lot. Not much parking. You can here the traffic on the street at night. It was just an ok hotel.

Good. The staff at the front desk were friendly and accommodating. The interior decoration of the room was nice. Free parking is a plus. The safe and the heater was not operable. Parking options was not plentiful. The breakfast options was basic.
Had a wonderful stay at the hotel. Location free breakfast free parking and WiFi. Breakfast no so good.
Great. The staff was very friendly. They helped us find fun things to do in the area tips on parking.

Great location. Close to the beach. The Shoal is very clean trendy and the beds are super comfortable. Shout out to the front desk staff Casey and Chris. Both were so friendly and helpful. And Chris came to the rescue when we noticed a dog in a hot car parked on the street. We had a lovely time and would stay here again.
